item.title: Object Spawning
item.dc:creator: @Nirvana.Marijuana Nirvana.Marijuana
item.description:
@Nirvana.Marijuana wrote:

[size=20pt]Remember ALWAYS use TAB NOT SPACES!!![/size]

If you want to add an object search for this in client.java

public void newObjects() {

Then add global object in this format

AddGlobalObject(ObID, Xcoord, Ycoord, (Facing, 10); //The Object

0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH Put one of those for the facing dont change the 10 and just change the rest
(ItemID, Xcoord, Ycoord and //The Object)

[hr][br]If you want item to spawn in the game and respawn go to itemspawnpoints.java and add 1 in use this

ItemHandler.addItem(ItemID, Xcoord, Ycoord, Amount, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); //The item

Change the things that arent filled in (ItemID, Xcoord, Ycoord, Amount and //The item)

Heres an example

ItemHandler.addItem(995, 3250, 3422, 10000000, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // coins

[hr][br][quote=“number-x, post:24, topic:69656”]
^
|
Java does this to you mentaly!!

client.java:65: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(2956, 3369, 11738, 2, 10);
^
client.java:66: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(2958, 3369, 11682, 1, 10);
^
client.java:67: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(2537, 4719, 823, 2, 10);
^
client.java:68: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(2537, 4717, 2513, 1, 10);
^
client.java:69: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(3011, 3358, 4150, 1, 10);
^
client.java:70: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client
makeGlobalObject(2960, 3374, 4151, 1, 10);
^
client.java:71: cannot find symbol
symbol : method makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int)
location: class client

^
client.java:72: cannot find symbol

location: class client

^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
8 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

You’ve done the wrong format for adding objects do what it says in my post (this one)

~Nirvana~

item.title: Object Spawning
item.dc:creator: @number-x number-x
item.description:
@number-x wrote:

[br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2007, 03:33:43 PM[/size][hr][code] public void ChangeDoor(int ArrayID) {
int objectID = server.objectHandler.ObjectOriID[ArrayID];
int objectX = server.objectHandler.ObjectX[ArrayID];
int objectY = server.objectHandler.ObjectY[ArrayID];
int Face = server.objectHandler.ObjectFace[ArrayID];
int Type = server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID];
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, -1, -1, 0);
switch (Type) {
case 1:
ReplaceObject2(objectX, (objectY + 1), objectID, Face, 0);
server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID] = 2;
break;
case 2:
ReplaceObject2(objectX, (objectY - 1), objectID, Face, 0);
server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID] = 1;
break;
case 3:
ReplaceObject2((objectX + 1), objectY, objectID, Face, 0);
server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID] = 4;
break;
case 4:
ReplaceObject2((objectX - 1), objectY, objectID, Face, 0);
server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID] = 3;
break;
}
}

public void ReplaceObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face) {
	outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60);
	outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
	outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));
	/*DELETE OBJECT*/
	outStream.writeByte(101);
	outStream.writeByteC(0);
	outStream.writeByte(0);
	/*CREATE OBJECT*/
	if (NewObjectID > -1) {
		outStream.writeByte(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteA(Face); //0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
	}
	outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
            }
public void ReplaceObject2(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
	outStream.createFrame(85);
	outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
	outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(101);
	outStream.writeByteC((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	outStream.writeByte(0);

	if (NewObjectID != -1) {
		outStream.createFrame(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteS((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
		//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
		//ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration
	}
}
public void AddGlobalObj(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
     for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
      {
       if(p != null) 
         {
          client person = (client)p;
          if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null"))
          {
           if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60)
           {
            person.ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);
           }
          }
         }
       }
  }

public void AddObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60);
outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));
/CREATE OBJECT/
if (NewObjectID > -1) {
outStream.writeByte(151);
outStream.writeByteS(0);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
outStream.writeByteA(Face); //0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
}
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
}[/code] ok i found this is this what your talking about ??

Read full topic

item.title: Object Spawning
item.dc:creator: @spiritlord99 spiritlord99
item.description:
@spiritlord99 wrote:

omg ppl!!!Does any1 know how to code anymore??

go to itemspawnpoints.java and put a item spawn such as

ItemHandler.addItem(4087, 2519, 3376, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // d legs

just change the 4087 to the x coords, and the 2519 to y coords, then change the 3376 to the item id, and finnaly change the 1 to the number of items u wana spawn (usually good with money)

Read full topic

item.title: Object Spawning
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

just incase u do here

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType, int hight){ //Makes Global objects
		for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
			if(p != null){
				client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){
				if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
					person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
	}

99.9% fedexder (sorry if i spelt name wrong)

0.1% me for getting
